00109   /* Used to checking reference counts, most while doing perl5 stuff :-) */
00110 #ifdef REF_PRINT
00111 #undef REF_PRINT
00112 #define REF_PRINT(a,b)  fprintf(stderr,"%08X:%4d:%s\n",(int)b,b->references,a)

00115 #ifndef DEVRANDOM
00116   /* set this to a comma-separated list of 'random' device files to try out.
00117    * My default, we will try to read at least one of these files */
00118 #define DEVRANDOM "/dev/urandom","/dev/random","/dev/srandom"
00119 #endif
00120 #ifndef DEVRANDOM_EGD
00121   /* set this to a comma-seperated list of 'egd' sockets to try out. These
00122    * sockets will be tried in the order listed in case accessing the device files
00123    * listed in DEVRANDOM did not return enough entropy. */
00124 #define DEVRANDOM_EGD "/var/run/egd-pool","/dev/egd-pool","/etc/egd-pool","/etc/entropy"
00125 #endif

00187 #if defined(WINDOWS)
00188 #define get_last_socket_error() WSAGetLastError()
00189 #define clear_socket_error()    WSASetLastError(0)
00190 #define readsocket(s,b,n)   recv((s),(b),(n),0)
00191 #define writesocket(s,b,n)  send((s),(b),(n),0)
00192 #define EADDRINUSE      WSAEADDRINUSE
00193 #elif defined(__DJGPP__)
00194 #define WATT32
00195 #define get_last_socket_error() errno
00196 #define clear_socket_error()    errno=0
00197 #define closesocket(s)      close_s(s)
00198 #define readsocket(s,b,n)   read_s(s,b,n)
00199 #define writesocket(s,b,n)  send(s,b,n,0)
00200 #elif defined(MAC_OS_pre_X)
00201 #define get_last_socket_error() errno
00202 #define clear_socket_error()    errno=0
00203 #define closesocket(s)      MacSocket_close(s)
00204 #define readsocket(s,b,n)   MacSocket_recv((s),(b),(n),true)
00205 #define writesocket(s,b,n)  MacSocket_send((s),(b),(n))
00206 #elif defined(OPENSSL_SYS_VMS)
00207 #define get_last_socket_error() errno
00208 #define clear_socket_error()    errno=0
00209 #define ioctlsocket(a,b,c)      ioctl(a,b,c)
00210 #define closesocket(s)          close(s)
00211 #define readsocket(s,b,n)       recv((s),(b),(n),0)
00212 #define writesocket(s,b,n)      send((s),(b),(n),0)
00213 #elif defined(OPENSSL_SYS_VXWORKS)
00214 #define get_last_socket_error() errno
00215 #define clear_socket_error()    errno=0
00216 #define ioctlsocket(a,b,c)      ioctl((a),(b),(int)(c))
00217 #define closesocket(s)          close(s)
00218 #define readsocket(s,b,n)       read((s),(b),(n))
00219 #define writesocket(s,b,n)      write((s),(char *)(b),(n))
00220 #else
00221 #define get_last_socket_error() errno
00222 #define clear_socket_error()    errno=0
00223 #define ioctlsocket(a,b,c)  ioctl(a,b,c)
00224 #define closesocket(s)      close(s)
00225 #define readsocket(s,b,n)   read((s),(b),(n))
00226 #define writesocket(s,b,n)  write((s),(b),(n))
00227 #endif

00320 #  ifdef OPENSSL_SYS_VMS
00321 #    define VMS 1
00322   /* some programs don't include stdlib, so exit() and others give implicit 
00323      function warnings */
00324 #    include <stdlib.h>
00325 #    if defined(__DECC)
00326 #      include <unistd.h>
00327 #    else
00328 #      include <unixlib.h>
00329 #    endif
00330 #    define OPENSSL_CONF    "openssl.cnf"
00331 #    define SSLEAY_CONF     OPENSSL_CONF
00332 #    define RFILE       ".rnd"
00333 #    define LIST_SEPARATOR_CHAR ','
00334 #    define NUL_DEV     "NLA0:"
00335   /* We don't have any well-defined random devices on VMS, yet... */
00336 #    undef DEVRANDOM
00337   /* We need to do this since VMS has the following coding on status codes:
00338 
00339      Bits 0-2: status type: 0 = warning, 1 = success, 2 = error, 3 = info ...
00340      The important thing to know is that odd numbers are considered
00341      good, while even ones are considered errors.
00342      Bits 3-15: actual status number
00343      Bits 16-27: facility number.  0 is considered "unknown"
00344      Bits 28-31: control bits.  If bit 28 is set, the shell won't try to
00345      output the message (which, for random codes, just looks ugly)
00346 
00347      So, what we do here is to change 0 to 1 to get the default success status,
00348      and everything else is shifted up to fit into the status number field, and
00349      the status is tagged as an error, which I believe is what is wanted here.
00350      -- Richard Levitte
00351    */
00352 #    define EXIT(n)     do { int __VMS_EXIT = n; \
00353                                      if (__VMS_EXIT == 0) \
00354                        __VMS_EXIT = 1; \
00355                      else \
00356                        __VMS_EXIT = (n << 3) | 2; \
00357                                      __VMS_EXIT |= 0x10000000; \
00358                      exit(__VMS_EXIT); } while(0)
00359 #    define NO_SYS_PARAM_H
00360 #  else
00361   /* !defined VMS */
00362 #    ifdef OPENSSL_SYS_MPE
00363 #      define NO_SYS_PARAM_H
00364 #    endif
00365 #    ifdef OPENSSL_UNISTD
00366 #      include OPENSSL_UNISTD
00367 #    else
00368 #      include <unistd.h>
00369 #    endif
00370 #    ifndef NO_SYS_TYPES_H
00371 #      include <sys/types.h>
00372 #    endif
00373 #    if defined(NeXT) || defined(OPENSSL_SYS_NEWS4)
00374 #      define pid_t int         /* pid_t is missing on NEXTSTEP/OPENSTEP
00375                                  * (unless when compiling with -D_POSIX_SOURCE,
00376                                  * which doesn't work for us) */
00377 #    endif
00378 #    if defined(NeXT) || defined(OPENSSL_SYS_NEWS4) || defined(OPENSSL_SYS_SUNOS)
00379 #      define ssize_t int       /* ditto */
00380 #    endif
00381 #    ifdef OPENSSL_SYS_NEWS4    /* setvbuf is missing on mips-sony-bsd */
00382 #      define setvbuf(a, b, c, d) setbuffer((a), (b), (d))
00383   typedef unsigned long clock_t;
00384 #    endif
00385 
00386 #    define OPENSSL_CONF    "openssl.cnf"
00387 #    define SSLEAY_CONF     OPENSSL_CONF
00388 #    define RFILE       ".rnd"
00389 #    define LIST_SEPARATOR_CHAR ':'
00390 #    define NUL_DEV     "/dev/null"
00391 #    define EXIT(n)     exit(n)
00392 #  endif
00393 
00394 #  define SSLeay_getpid()   getpid()
00395 
00396 #endif

00401 #ifdef USE_SOCKETS

00404 
00405 #    ifdef OPENSSL_NO_SOCK
00406 #      define SSLeay_Write(a,b,c)   (-1)
00407 #      define SSLeay_Read(a,b,c)    (-1)
00408 #      define SHUTDOWN(fd)      close(fd)
00409 #      define SHUTDOWN2(fd)     close(fd)
00410 #    elif !defined(__DJGPP__)
00411 #      include <winsock.h>
00412   extern HINSTANCE _hInstance;
00413 #      define SSLeay_Write(a,b,c)   send((a),(b),(c),0)
00414 #      define SSLeay_Read(a,b,c)    recv((a),(b),(c),0)
00415 #      define SHUTDOWN(fd)      { shutdown((fd),0); closesocket(fd); }
00416 #      define SHUTDOWN2(fd)     { shutdown((fd),2); closesocket(fd); }
00417 #    else
00418 #      define SSLeay_Write(a,b,c)   write_s(a,b,c,0)
00419 #      define SSLeay_Read(a,b,c)    read_s(a,b,c)
00420 #      define SHUTDOWN(fd)      close_s(fd)
00421 #      define SHUTDOWN2(fd)     close_s(fd)
00422 #    endif
00423

00428 #    define SSLeay_Read(a,b,c)      MacSocket_recv((a),(b),(c),true)
00429 #    define SHUTDOWN(fd)        MacSocket_close(fd)
00430 #    define SHUTDOWN2(fd)       MacSocket_close(fd)
00431

00521 # define memmove(s1,s2,n) bcopy((s2),(s1),(n))
